Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic by suggesting that it did not affect the US mortality rate based on a comparison of incomplete data.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it relies on incomplete and misleading data to make its assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that comparing death tolls over different time periods without proper adjustment is a valid method for determining the impact of the pandemic on the mortality rate.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there have been significant excess deaths in 2020 compared to previous years, as reported by the CDC researcher.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the increase in deaths in 2020, such as the impact of Covid-19.
